books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: Ashenden
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short stories based on the experiences of an intelligence agent during World War I.

books.title: A Yankee in the Trenches
books.author: Robert Derby Holmes
books.summary: An American describes his experiences in the British Army in the First World War.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Just So Stories
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: A collection of short humorous fables for children, most purporting to tell the origin of animal characteristics such as the camel’s hump.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.

books.title: The Tempest
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A magic-induced tempest shipwrecks the king of Naples and his crew on an island inhabited by the usurped duke of Milan.

books.title: The Water of the Wondrous Isles
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: A beautiful woman escapes a life of servitude under an evil witch to adventure through a series of magical islands.

books.title: The Splendid Fairing
books.author: Constance Holme
books.summary: An elderly couple tries to deal with an unfavorable financial situation, deteriorating health, and the absence of their son while living in a tight-knit community that doesn’t hold them in high esteem.

books.title: The Private Memoirs and Confessions of a Justified Sinner
books.author: James Hogg
books.summary: A religious fanatic’s mysterious friend helps turn him into a killer.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: The Tower Treasure
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: After a tower mansion is robbed, two boys are determined to find the culprit and exonerate their friend’s father.

books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: Moribund Society and Anarchy
books.author: Jean Grave
books.summary: Jean Grave systemically critiques bourgeois society from an anarchist perspective.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Sarah Louisa Forten Purvis
books.summary: A collection of poems by Sarah Louisa Forten Purvis.

books.title: Martin Eden
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A young working-class man sets out to become a bourgeois writer.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Tanizaki Jun’ichirō
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Tanizaki Jun’ichirō, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
